event: rigidity in the left upper extremity
increased tone on the left side
troponin level increased from 0.16 ng/ml–0.38 ng/ml
elevated white blood cell count of 682×10^9/l
computed tomography scan showed no intracranial hemorrhage
incidental finding of 778 mm mass concerning an aneurysm
Methicillin-sensitive staphylococcal aureus in the blood
transesophageal echo showed vegetation in the aortic valve
MRI showed large posterior cerebral artery infarct
consulted cardiothoracic surgery team for aortic valve replacement
repeat computed tomography head scan showed intraparenchymal bleed
bacterial meningitis secondary to infective endocarditis
intraparenchymal bleed in the right frontal area
